intro: Leptocladia elongata, commonly known as the elongated chain algae, is a species of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its long, ribbon-like thallus that often forms dense, gelatinous mats on submerged surfaces. This plant typically grows in coastal areas, attaching itself to rocks, docks, and other submerged structures. Its structure consists of a single, continuous filament that can extend several centimeters in length. Leptocladia elongata plays a vital role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
